Description: Several joining fragments with additional plaster of a shallow pottery bowl. Inside and out covered with white slip and decorated with bands of black glaze. In the centre inside, a large star.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Robinson identifies the vase as Chian.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 213, no. 26)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 111, no. 322, pl. XXXV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.712)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5939 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
